summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel raising issues with discovery in her case. The chain involves prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and Maxwell's defense attorney, Christian Everdell, who sent a formal letter on behalf of the defense team.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who sent a formal letter on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team regarding discovery issues to the prosecutors.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused individual whose defense counsel is communicating with prosecutors about discovery matters in her criminal case.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen

connections.description: Everdell is acting as defense counsel for Maxwell, communicating formally with prosecutors on her behalf regarding discovery issues.
Cohen is part of Maxwell's defense legal team, as indicated by his inclusion in the email from her lead counsel.

events.title: Defense Counsel Sends Discovery Letter
events.description: Christian Everdell, on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, sends a formal letter to prosecutors regarding discovery issues in Maxwell's case.

events.title: Prosecutors Coordinate Response to Defense Letter
events.description: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discuss scheduling a call with MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) legal counsel and working with paralegals and IT staff to address the discovery issues raised by Maxwell's defense.

locations: 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office)
MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, likely in Brooklyn, NY)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, led by Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP, formally raised issues regarding discovery in her criminal case in September 2020.
The defense legal team included attorneys Mark S. Cohen, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.
Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York were coordinating a response, including contacting the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) legal counsel.
The communication highlights ongoing pre-trial legal procedures and discovery disputes in Maxwell's case.
The email chain demonstrates formal attorney-client relationships and professional legal correspondence within the high-profile case.
